result.execSummary:
The defendant John E Hengst was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, John E Hengst was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John E Hengst is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • John E Hengst was found guilty of Reckless Driving-Cause Bodily Harm, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

supervisions.notes: Must report to probation by 3:00 PM on 1/9/2017.

miscConds.notes: Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.  Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge. Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail on Thursday, January 5, 2017, between 1:00 and 5:00 PM, to submit DNA sample.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
Per order of the Judge dated 1/4/2017.

03/03/2017 AMENDED - COURT ORDERS $20,956.03 IN RESTITUTION PER THE C-31. COURT ORDERS CIVIL SETTLEMENTS TO BE APPLIED TO THIS AMOUNT.
08/28/2017 AMENDED TO REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF RESTITUTION FROM $20,956.03 TO $12,599.09 PER THE AMENDED C-31.

timeConds.notes: Court stays jail until 1/9/17. Jail will be stayed beyond 1/9/17 if Notice of Appeal is filed.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John E Hengst in court with attorney Frederick A Bechtold.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
8:59 a.m. court in session with Jury.  State moves to admit Exhibit 64.  Court receives.  State rests.  
9:00 a.m. Defense motion. Jurors excused.  Motion for directive verdict on OWI.  State objects.  Court denies motion.
9:04 a.m. Jury returns.  
9:06 a.m. Witness Brenda T. called and sworn, and direct by Attorney Bechtold.  9:21 a.m. cross by Attorney Beranek.  9:26 a.m. redirect by Attorney Bechtold.  
9:26 a.m. Witness Scott A. called and sworn, and direct by Attorney Bechtold.   9:33 a.m. no cross by Attorney Beranek.  9:34 a.m. Jury excused.
Attorney Bechtold requests time to speak with Defendant regarding him testifying.  9:39 a.m. court resumes outside presence of Jury.  Court questions Defendant of his right to testify or not.  Court accepts Defendant's decision to not testify.  
Court reviews with attorneys final jury instructions and verdict. 9:54 court recesses.  10:03 a.m. court reconvenes and Jury returns.  Defense testimony closed.  Judge reads Jury Instructions.  10:24 a.m. closing argument by State.  10:43 a.m. closing argument by Defense.  11:11 a.m. rebuttal by State.  11:19 a.m. closing Jury instructions read by Court. 11:24 a.m. Bailiff sworn.  Court gives Jury instructions and Jury Verdict forms to Bailiff.  11:25 a.m. Jury begins deliberation.  Attorneys have no objection to Court's reading of Jury Instructions.  Photos and driving record Exhibits will go to Jury.  Report of Inspector Krisher and CV's will not go to Jury.  Court will not send in Exhibits 3, 39, 42, or 43.  All other Exhibits will go to Jury. 11:29 a.m. Court adjourns.  
12:49 p.m. Jury returns with verdict.  

Count 1 - Not Guilty
Count 2 - Guilty
Citation 1 - Guilty
Citation 2 - Guilty

Jurors polled. 12:54 p.m. Jurors excused. 
Judgment of Acquittal on Count 1.
Judgment of Conviction on Count 2 and citations 15TR1572 and 15TR1573.  
Court recesses 12:55 p.m.
Court resumes 1:00 p.m. Argument by State. 1:04 p.m argument by Defense.  1:05 p.m. Defendant waives right to allocution.  1:06 p.m. Court addresses Defendant.

Court relates and orders:
15TR1572:   $213.10 forfeiture 60 DTP
15TR1573:   $175.30 forfeiture 60 DTP
15CF567 - Count 2:  
Withheld sentence.  
1 year Probation ordered and must report to probation Monday 1/9/17 by 3 p.m.
30 days in jail stayed until Monday 1/9/17
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.  
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
DNA sample and surcharge.
$300 fine plus costs.
Jail will be stayed beyond 1/9/17 if Notice of Appeal is filed.

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail on Thursday, January 5, 2017, between 1:00 and 5:00 PM, to submit DNA sample

Defendant John E Hengst in court with attorney Frederick A Bechtold.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CF567, 15TR1572 and 15TR1573
8:33 Case called outside the presence of the jury. Defendant waives right to open jury voir dire for sensitive topics. Court accepts waiver. 
Attorney Bechtold's motion in Limine discussed. State relates regarding #3. Court grants motion however #3 will be held open. Court grants State's motion in Limine. 
Court excludes all witnesses except Court Officer Graf. 8:40 Court in recess.

Sharon M., Clerk
8:43 20 jurors seated.  8:45 All jurors sworn.  8:46 Court voir dire.  No State voir dire.  No defense voir dire.  9:15 Peremptory strikes made and Court gives preliminary jury instructions.  9:28 12 jurors sworn.  9:29 Jury excused.  9:30 State's motion for impeachment.  No objection by defense.  Court grants impeachment motion - 4 crimes.  9:32 Jury instructions reviewed.  Court questions defendant regarding elements of crime.  Defendant stipulates to agreeing to having a prior conviction.  9:35 Court recesses.

Rochele W., Clerk Exhibits 1 - 63 marked by State. 
9:57 Jurors seated. Court reads opening jury instructions. 10:03 State makes opening statement. 10:17 Defense makes opening statement. 10:29 Vincent Graf, Patrol Sergeant with the Barron County Sheriff's Department, called, sworn and direct by State. Witness draws diagram on board. Exhibit 1 - Informing the accused. Offered and received. Exhibit 2 - Blood/Urine Analysis form. Offered and received. Exhibit 3 - Certificate of Driving Record. Offered and received. 
10:53 Cross by Attorney Bechtold. 11:23 Redirect by State. 11:25 Rick Schill, Patrol Deputy with the Barron County Sheriff's Department, called, sworn and direct by State. Exhibit 6-38 photographs by Deputy Schill. Offered and received. 11:58 Jurors excused for lunch. 11:59 court in recess. 12:51 Jurors seated. Court resumes, State resume direct examination. 12:53 Cross by Defense. 1:15 Redirect by State. 1:18 Deputy Schill may be excused. 1:19 Louise D. called sworn and direct by State. 1:32 Cross by Defense. 1:35 Redirect by State. Witness may be excused. 1:36 Jim H. called, sworn and direct by State. Exhibit 4 - Voluntary Statement of J.H., offered and received. 1:58 Witness may be excused. 1:59 Jurors excused. Court in recess for 10 minutes. 2:13 Jurors seated. 2:15 Gary P., called, sworn and direct by State. Exhibit 5 - Voluntary Statement of G.P. 2:25 Cross by Defense. 2:27 Redirect by State. 2:28 Witness excused. 2:29 Billie Robbins, Controlled Substance Analysis with the Wisconsin State Crime Lab, called, sworn and direct by State. Exhibit 39 - Statement of Qualification for Billie Robbins, offered and received. Exhibit 40 - Lab results, offered and received. 2:39 Jurors excused, court resumes outside the presence of the jury. Attorney Bechtold relates. State relates. Court reviews Exhibit 41. State would offer exhibit 41, objection by Defense, Court denies exhibit 41. Court makes ruling regarding questioning. 2:54 Jurors seated. State proceeds with direct examination. 3:00 Cross by Defense. 3:06 Redirect by State; Recross by Defense. Witness excused. 3:07 Richard Krisher, Inspector with the Wisconsin State Patrol, called, sworn and direct by State. Exhibit 42 - Curriculum Vitae of Richard Krisher, offered and received. Exhibit 43 - Mechanical Inspection Report, offered and received. Exhibits 44-63 Photos by Inspector Krisher, offered and received. 3:38 Cross by Defense. 3:58 Redirect by State. 4:03 Recross by Defense. 4:07 Testimony closed for today - witness is not excused. Court reads jury instruction. Jurors to return at 8:30 AM tomorrow. 4:07 Jurors excused for today. 4:08 Court resumes outside the presense of the jury. 4:11 Parties excused.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.
Must report to Barron County Jail for fingerprinting between 1:00 PM and 5:00 PM on Tuesday, December 22, 2015.

Defendant John E Hengst in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond for today.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Does not qualify for Public Defender.  Blue form presented and defendant sworn.  Court appoints Laura Sutton and orders repayment of $25.00 per month beginning 2/1/16 by direct pay.  Reading of Complaint waived.  Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver of time limits.  Bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

File to JA to notify Atty Sutton of appointment
